data.title: Douglas injury is new blow to Britain's hopes in Osaka
data.meta_description: Athletics: Nathan Douglas, the British triple jumper, has been ruled out of the world championships in Osaka with a torn hamstring.
data.text:
Britain's battered world championship medal hopes suffered another blow yesterday when the triple jumper Nathan Douglas was ruled out of next month's event in Osaka with injury - the latest medal chance to miss the summer's main attraction. Douglas, 24, has won silver at the last two championships - last year's Europeans in Gothenburg and the European Indoors in Birmingham in March. But he suffered a hamstring tear in Madrid last Saturday, and yesterday it was confirmed he will not recover in time.

Dave Collins, UK Athletics' performance director, said: "It is bad news, particularly for an athlete who in the past has shown his consistency and that he can challenge for major championship medals. His absence will be a great loss." Meanwhile the US sprinter Tyson Gay will make another attempt to break the 100 metres world record at the Grand Prix at Crystal Palace on Friday week.
